snippet: In a trial, the pill, called Quad, had roughly the same rate of side effects as two existing therapies, but patients did slightly better when their blood was tested for the virus.
abstract: Studies published in The Lancet show that Quad, a new once-a-day pill combining four AIDS drugs, has proved slightly more effective than two existing once-a-day regimens; pill is made by Gilead Sciences and is expected to be approved by the Food and Drug Administration later in 2012.
lead_paragraph: In a trial, the pill, called Quad, had roughly the same rate of side effects as two existing therapies, but patients did slightly better when their blood was tested for the virus.

headline.seo: Quad Once-a-Day Pill Tests Better Than Other Regimens
headline.main: AIDS: New Four-Drug Pill Taken Daily Tests Better Than Other Regimens
headline.print_headline: Aids: New Four-Drug Pill Taken Daily Tests Better Than Other Regimens
